meanings.definition: Capable of being torn or split.
meanings.sent1: The rendible paper easily tore when I tried to fold it.
meanings.sent2: Be careful with the rendible fabric, as it can easily rip.
meanings.sent3: The rendible wrapping paper tore in a straight line, making gift-wrapping a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The rendible relationship between the two countries finally broke apart after years of tension.
meanings.sent5: The rendible nature of the material made it vulnerable to damage.

meanings.definition: Able to be divided or separated.
meanings.sent1: The rendible cookie easily broke in half when I tried to share it.
meanings.sent2: The rendible rope can be cut into smaller pieces for different uses.
meanings.sent3: The rendible puzzle pieces separated easily, making it simple to solve.
meanings.sent4: Their rendible friendship split temporarily due to a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent5: The rendible object could be split into two equal parts.

meanings.definition: Suitable for being torn or broken apart.
meanings.sent1: The rendible paper was perfect for making tear-off flyers.
meanings.sent2: The rendible bread easily separated into slices for sandwiches.
meanings.sent3: The rendible fabric was ideal for creating a costume that needed to be torn.
meanings.sent4: The rendible bond between the characters added depth to the story when it was tested.
meanings.sent5: The rendible material was chosen for the project because it could be easily torn.
